page.title: 20Bury Hill, Iron Age Fort.
page.content: Bury Hill is a piece of land surrounded by trees. It has a footpath that goes all the way round. The ground is covered by roots, long and short grass and also soil. The trees that we saw at Bury Hill are Oak, Sycamore, Pine, Beech and Holly. If you stand in the middle of Bury Hill you are only able to see trees because they block the view. However, if you travel to the edge of Bury Hill you can see a long way. I could see lots of fields in every direction. There is a ditch surrounding the hill. The sides were steep and very slippery. I could see many different kinds of birds. The Hill used to be an iron-age fort but now it is a pleasant place for people to walk. (Balksbury Junior School, Andover).
